Tips: Smooth inputs lead to faster lap times than jerky corrections.
Trail braking helps rotate the car into tight corners.
Look ahead to where you want to go, not at your hood.
In wet conditions, the racing line becomes slippery. Try alternative lines.
Weight transfer is key - braking shifts weight forward, acceleration shifts it back.
Feather the throttle out of slow corners to avoid wheelspin.
The fastest line isn't always the obvious one. Experiment!
Use reference points for braking and turn-in to be consistent.
Initiate drifts with the handbrake, throttle, or weight transfer.
Counter-steer to control your drift angle - look where you want to go.
Maintain throttle to keep the rear wheels spinning during a drift.
Link drifts together for massive combo multipliers.
Rear-wheel drive cars are naturally easier to drift.
Softer rear suspension helps break traction more easily.
Scandinavian flick: turn opposite first, then snap back to initiate.
Softer front springs reduce understeer, stiffer rear springs reduce oversteer.
Lower ride height improves aerodynamics but watch for bottoming out.
Wider tires provide more grip but also more drag.
Weight reduction improves acceleration, braking, AND handling.
Turbo adds power but introduces lag. Plan your shifts accordingly.
Short gear ratios improve acceleration, tall ratios improve top speed.
Negative camber improves cornering grip but wears tires unevenly.
Save nitrous for straights where you can use all the power.
Draft behind opponents to recharge nitrous and save fuel.
Sometimes it's faster to brake late and pass on corner exit.
Learn the track before pushing - memorize braking points.
In elimination races, staying ahead early reduces pressure.
Watch your mirrors - defending position is as important as attacking.
Winning races earns more than just finishing - push for the podium!
Higher REP tiers unlock better parts and exclusive vehicles.
Sell unused parts to fund upgrades for your main car.
Daily and weekly challenges offer bonus cash and REP.
Crew membership provides discounts at shops.
Mystery boxes can contain rare parts at a fraction of their value.
Explore the map thoroughly - there are hidden rewards everywhere.
Some locations only appear at certain times of day.
Photo mode isn't just for screenshots - some secrets require it.
The underground has more to offer than meets the eye.
Legends speak of hidden vehicles waiting to be discovered...
